phases.name: Phase 1 – Hardware Foundations & Modern Embedded C++
phases.description: Calibrate hardware lab, sharpen modern C++ for microcontrollers, and build disciplined debugging habits. End goal: confidently shipping bring-up firmware on STM32 and ESP32 targets.

tasks.title: Decode Ohm's/Kirchhoff laws with AI co-pilots
tasks.description: Work through daily voltage/current/power drills in Notion (Concept → Formula → MCU tie-in) while using Codex to produce quick C calculators for sanity checks.
tasks.ai_prompt: Generate a C utility that solves Kirchhoff loop equations given resistor arrays and expected rail voltages.

tasks.title: Component characterization lab
tasks.description: Simulate common-passive circuits in Tinkercad/Wokwi and log oscilloscope-style screenshots explaining how the behavior maps to MCU power rails.
tasks.ai_prompt: Review my RC/RL simulation captures and highlight regimes where MCU brownouts are likely.

tasks.title: Instrumentation setup & lab hygiene
tasks.description: Label probes, create udev rules for bench gear, and document ESD/grounding procedures in a Git-tracked lab handbook.
tasks.ai_prompt: Suggest improvements to my lab SOP for static safety and repeatable measurements.

weeks.focus: Week 2 – Circuit simulation sprints & power supply literacy

tasks.title: Tinkercad/Wokwi simulation marathon
tasks.description: Build and document three mini-circuits (voltage divider, RC filter, op-amp buffer) with annotated screenshots and Git commits.
tasks.ai_prompt: Explain how my Tinkercad plots translate to real PCB traces and what tolerances to watch.

tasks.title: Power-supply troubleshooting drills
tasks.description: Model buck/boost regulators, calculate ripple, and simulate load steps using LTspice or Falstad.
tasks.ai_prompt: Given regulator parameters, estimate safe output ripple for STM32 analog rails.

tasks.title: Weekly review & debugging retro
tasks.description: Spend Sunday running QEMU/GDB dry-runs of simple C firmware that prints computed voltages, logging any bugs plus AI advice in Notion.
tasks.ai_prompt: Audit my review notes and propose follow-up drills for weak electronics areas.

weeks.focus: Week 3 – Digital logic blueprints & finite-state thinking

tasks.title: Truth tables → Logisim simulations
tasks.description: Model combinational circuits (encoders, multiplexers and adders) in Logisim, exporting timing diagrams with annotations.
tasks.ai_prompt: Review my Logisim design files; point out hazards or redundant gates.

tasks.title: FSM practice in C
tasks.description: Implement 4-bit adder and elevator FSMs in pure C and run them under QEMU/VS Code tests.
tasks.ai_prompt: Explain whether my FSM encoding is Moore or Mealy and optimize for readability.

tasks.title: Signal integrity primer
tasks.description: Study rise/fall times, metastability, and debouncing using Saleae captures plus simulated noise.
tasks.ai_prompt: Given recorded traces, highlight metastability risks and suggest synchronization tactics.

tasks.description: Tune BIOS/firmware, configure Ubuntu + Windows dev environments, and document GPU/QEMU setups.

weeks.focus: Week 6 – Memory, pointers, and ISR-grade C idioms

tasks.title: Pointer gym & allocator simulator
tasks.description: Implement a mini heap/stack visualizer in C, run it under Valgrind, and screenshot leaks/fixes.
tasks.ai_prompt: Show me why my allocator approach might fragment memory on small MCUs.

tasks.title: Bit manipulation + register maps
tasks.description: Practice volatile/bitfield tricks by modeling GPIO registers for UNO + STM32, ensuring MISRA safety.
tasks.ai_prompt: Validate my bitfield macros and flag undefined behavior risks.

tasks.title: ISR basics & latency drills
tasks.description: Write mock ISRs in C, test them with QEMU timers, and document prologue/epilogue considerations.

projects.name: LabOps Automation Suite
projects.description: Git-managed checklist for the MSI B850M + Ryzen 7 7700 rig covering BIOS profiles, dual-boot imaging, GPU drivers, and VS Code devcontainer setup.

projects.name: Foundation Electronics Notebook
projects.description: Notion + markdown knowledge base of voltage divider calculators, LTspice sims, and measurement SOPs with accompanying Python/C utilities.

projects.name: Digital Logic Playground
projects.description: Logisim + C portfolio demonstrating FSMs, 4-bit adders, and QEMU-backed simulations with video walkthroughs.

projects.name: Protocol Explorer Pack
projects.description: Suite of UART/I2C/SPI experiments (bit-banged UART, analyzer captures, minicom scripts) packaged with READMEs and troubleshooting checklists.

phases.name: Phase 2 – Real-Time Systems & Connected Firmware
phases.description: Deepen RTOS mastery, tackle open RISC-V/ESP32-C3 bring-up, design resilient connectivity stacks, and harden security for fleet-ready firmware. Culminates in a production-quality Zephyr/FreeRTOS application spanning CAN, Ethernet, BLE, and secure provisioning.

projects.name: Zephyr Multi-Protocol Connectivity Gateway
projects.description: Deliver a Zephyr-based IoT gateway that bridges CAN, BLE, Ethernet, and MQTT with resilient reconnect logic and field diagnostics.

projects.name: Secure OTA Update Orchestrator
projects.description: Build an MCU + gateway orchestration layer that signs, encrypts, and stages FreeRTOS/Zephyr firmware updates with rollback telemetry.

projects.name: Fleet Diagnostics Telemetry Stack
projects.description: Implement structured logging, health monitoring, and Prometheus/Grafana exporters for edge nodes and gateways.

projects.name: Digital Twin Provisioning Portal
projects.description: Create a provisioning workflow that pairs hardware IDs with digital twins, secrets, and manufacturing test certificates.

phases.name: Phase 3 – Edge Intelligence, Safety & Manufacturing Readiness
phases.description: Blend TinyML with safety-critical practices, Android Automotive integration, and manufacturing readiness. Harden products for compliance while building intelligent firmware paired with production test rigs and certification artefacts.
